full_text:
Assigning Activities

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe primary assignment
¢ Assign an activity

i Primary versus role-based assignment

¢ Primary assignment (discussed in
this lesson)

* The entity can have a single owner only

* In the base configuration, this applies to
Activity entities

¢ Role-based assignment

* The entity has a set of users — with different
roles — assigned to it

* In the base configuration, this applies to
Account, Job (and its subtypes), and
Policy entities

Activity User

Producer

Policy @
<9

Underwriter

i Typical flow of assignment execution

mi

Assign

Nothing specified to group

Group specified

Assign To * Eastern Region Underwriting ~ Q

Assign
to user

Default Group Activity
Assignment Rules
Group and user specified

Assign To * Bruce Baker (Los Angeles Bra ~ Q.

i Activity ownership Gi

« An activity is owned by (assigned to) both a user and a group
* The assigned user must be a member of the assigned group
« Assigning “just” a user also assigns that user’s default group

¢ When an activity is assigned to a user:
+ It appears in that user's My Activities desktop list

* It can be edited only by that user (or other users with appropriate permissions, such as the
owner's supervisor)

¢ It can be viewed by other users in the group

i Activity assignment

In PolicyCenter, an activity is assigned by:

+ Assignment rules, or > 8s"

« Assignment classes, or

* Combination of both

i Activity assignment rule sets Ga
© DefaultGroupActivityAssignmentRules.grs x

GP Rule Sets
© Bl Assignment [9% © Default Group Activity Assignment Rules
(© DefaultGroupAccountAssignmentRules ©) [Yj Assign Round Robin

¢ GlobalActivityAssignmentRules assign activity to a group and may also assign to
a user

* Has rules that assign an activity by job role
* OOTB Default rule assigns to the underwriter
¢ DefaultGroupActivityAssignmentRules assigns activity to user in assigned group

* Has arule that assigns activity to user in a group using round-robin

i Initiating activity assignment from Gosu

Gi

¢ Bycalling autoAssign() methods ¢ By calling other activity

assignment methods
directly in assignment
classes

* Invokes activity assignment engine
* Can cause assignment rules to be run
+ Do not call autoAssign() from within an assignment rule! @

Signature Assignment rules to be run

Activity.autoAssign() Global and Default Group

Activity.autoAssign( group, null)

Default Group

Activity.autoAssign( group, user)

None

Activity.assign( group, user )

None

Assign To + Bruce Baker (Los Angeles Bra ~ Q

i autoAssign() example Ga

¢ Business requirement: Create an activity informing a user in the account creator
group that a participant was updated on the account

¢ Solution

* Add code to PreUpdateHandlerlmpl class, which executes logic before saving data to DB

* Only default group rule set will run since group is specified

i Common assignment strategies Ga

« Assign to a specific group and then round-robin among users

« Round robin ignores users that lack permission to own the object

« Round-robin functionality can be configured to take into account user workload/load factors
¢ Assign to a specific group and user

¢ Assign to a queue

i Common assignment methods

These methods on the Activity entity

* Can be used in assignment rules

* Can be called in assignment classes directly to initiate activity assignment

Context Method Assigns to...

Group assignGroup() Named group

Group assignGroupByLocation() Group matching specified location
and group type

User assign() Named user (and group)

User assignUserAndDefaultGroup() Named user (default group)

Queue assignActivityToQueue() Named queue

i Classes you can configure

Methods you may need to modify activity assignment logic are under
gsrc/gw/assignment:

« AuditAssignmentEnhancement
¢ JobAssignmentEnhancement
« Example: createRoleActivity() method on Job entity

+ Creates activity from a specified ActivityPattern

+ Assigns to a user with a specified role on the job

i Always exit rule when configuring assignment rules Gi

« When assignment succeeds

This avoids reassigning an entity that has just been assigned
¢ Assignment methods return boolean values

* True > assignment was successful

* False unsuccessful, appropriate group (or user) could not be found

Place methods in if/exit wrapper to exit assignment rule set as needed

var theGroup = activity.Job.getUserRoleAssignmentByRole( "Underwriter" ).AssignedGroup
if (activity.assign( theGroup, theGroup.Supervisor )) {

actions.exit()
} S$
If assignment is successful,

ensures that no other
assignment is done

i Demonstration G
Activity assignment basics

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

i Assigning to a specific group

« Assign object to a specified group

¢ Syntax:
object.assignGroup ( group )

// Ass: y to Lo. anch UW group
var group = activity.findGroup("Los Angeles Branch UN")
if (activity.assignGroup(group)) {

actions.exit()

u

i Assigning to group by type and location

¢ Assigns to group:
* Of specified group type...
* ...whose region covers specified address...
* ...including only direct child groups or all descendent groups...
* ...beginning with children of specified group
+ Specified group typically set to null or <entity>.AssignedGroup
¢ Using round-robin

¢ Syntax: object.assignGroupByLocation (
groupType, address, directChildrenOnly, group)

if (activity.assignGroupByLocation (
typekey.GroupType.IC_HOMEOFFICEADMIN, policyPeriod.PolicyAddress.Address, false, null)) {
actions.exit()

}

i Step 1: Identify candidate groups Gi

if (activity.assignGroupByLocation(
typekey.GroupType.IC_HOMEOFFICEADMIN, policyPeriod.PolicyAddress.Address,[false, null)) {
actions.exit()

i Configuring location selection

¢ Selection by location uses zones and
regions
¢ Azone is a type of geographic area

« Examples: State/province, county, city,
postal code

* Configured in zone-config.xml

¢ Aregion is a collection of specific zone
values, configured through
Administration tab

San Diego Local Area

« Western States
Region

* San Diego Local Area

Name ‘San Diego Local Area

* State of Michigan plus Chicago Areas Covered CAimperal, CAsSan Diego

« Assigns object to both a group and user

i Assigning to a user and any group

¢ Assigns object to a user and any group that the user belongs to

¢ Syntax:
object.assignUserAndDefaultGroup (User)

actions.exit()

Question G

,~ — Whatis the difference between primary and secondary assignment?

¢
4
¢

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer Gi

,~ — What is the difference between primary and secondary assignment?

¢
4
¢

In primary assignment, a single user is assigned ownership of the assigned object. In
secondary assignment, one or more users are assigned to roles with respect to the
assigned object.

SS Se ee eee eo

Question G

,~ — When an activity is assigned by rules, which two rule sets are typically
oo executed? In what order?

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer Gi

,~ — When an activity is assigned by rules, which two rule sets are typically
Fa executed? In what order?

First, global rules are executed. Then, default group rules are executed.

SS Se ee eee eo

Question G

,~ — Under what circumstances can an activity be assigned without

oo assignment rules being executed?

¢

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer

,~ — Under what circumstances can an activity be assigned without

Fa assignment rules being executed?

¢

When the activity is assigned to a specific user.

SS Se ee eee eo

Question G

,- — Why are assignment methods always inside i‘ statements in assignment

7 rules?
0 ! ’
7

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer Gi

,- — Why are assignment methods always inside i statements in assignment
Fa rules?
¢

Assignment methods are always inside if statements because they might fail. For
example, an assignGroup method may not be able to find the specified group.

If the assignment succeeds, then the if statement causes control of flow to execute an
actions.exit() statement, which exits execution from the rule set.

If the assignment fails, then the actions.exit() statement is skipped and execution
proceeds to the next rule.

SS Se ee eee eo

Question G

,~ — What is the Default Owner of an object?

¢
4
¢

SS oe ee oe oe oo

Answer Gi

,~ — What is the Default Owner of an object?
¢
4
¢

Default Owner is a dummy user that objects are assigned to when global assignment
rules fail to assign the object to a group.

SS Se ee eee eo
